comment: Take this professor if you have the chance. Easy A class for sure. Lots of homework and tests/quizzes can be lengthy but the work is easy and she is not a tough grader
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: If you want an easy A class, this is the one for you. She gives biweekly assignments with multiple attempts for each (the answers are also practically given on the second attempt). The three main assignments are Concert reports. They are 750 words and can be written about an online or in-person concert. Very fun and easy!

The class is easy, it's just a lot of work that can be time consuming, but she gives you 2 weeks to complete it all. Tests can vary from 75 to 100 questions long and she makes you do 3 concert reports. She does give you an extra 2 weeks at the end of the semester to makeup any work without penalty though.
This class I took online and It was so easy!! Easy A... TAKE IT.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: three concert reports and a few discussions were kind of annoying but an easy grader I really recommend her. each unit has two listening assignments and you have multiple chances to get the question right. two quizzes w two chances to get the right answer. test has like 75 questions its all really easy highly recommend!
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: The class is really easy as long as you keep track of your work. All grades are due every two weeks and includes 2 listening assignments, 2 quizzes, and 1 test per unit occasionally there are discussions due and you get extra points for responding to multiple people. You have multiple chances to get the right answer and almost guaranteed an easy a.

VERY easy class. There are 7 units I believe. There are two quizzes (40q), two listening assignments (35q), one discussion post, (you have to reply to two people) and an exam (75-80q). There are three concert reports which are kind of annoying.Tests and quizzes do not have lockdown and she's a fairly easy grader. Its not a hard class whatsoever.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Easiest class you will ever take love this professor! Everyone is on connect just about except for 3 concert reports which are very simple and fun to do. You get to listen to a lot of good music in this class. Highly recommend this professor to everyone!!

She is a great teacher to fill the university requirement of taking music in society. She is an easy grader, but most quizzes are done inside the online textbook. Quizlet is a great study guide for all assignments, and there are only 3 papers throughout the semester. Easy A.
The class has 7or8 modules each with PowerPoint slides, music clips, and online assessments and tests. The work can be long and tiring but its an easy A if you pay attention.

She mixes lots of music clips in with her lectures to keep things interesting. Her voice is anything but monotone which helps keep students engaged. A fair bit of homework but most of it is just listening to clips of music. Tests aren't super hard & they're all open note. When I had tech issues she was very helpful & gave me an extension.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Justus is very passionate about what she teaches. Gives great lectures and is willing to help you if you need anything. Keep in mind that this class is very heavy on lectures (Recorded), and you will have weekly writing assignments and quizzes. The final exam is mostly free-response and is 100 questions, which took about 7 hours to complete.

My favorite class that I took this semester. Dr. Justus is an outstanding professor who clearly cares about what she teaches. Grades are very concise, each unit has a discussion board, 1-2 assigned listenings, and a test (no Lockdown). There are 3 concert reports throughout the semester as well. This class is amazing. Best professor I've had at KSU

Pushes due dates if class isn't ready, loads of extra credit, goes over the quiz, answers questions, very detailed in person and online, lectures and power-point related quiz material, emails quickly, engaging in D2L announcements, encourages participation, detailed schedule, in-person class isn't lecture heavy and a positive professor overall.

She's a great teacher. There's a couple discussion boards, and you have to take notes. There's 3 concert reports, and they're pretty easy. Take good notes, all quizzes/tests aren't proctored, and be able to recognize songs. It's a pretty easy class overall.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This class has been a NIGHTMARE! This teacher assigns so much work for a music class. We have 3 concert essay reports in a semester (750 words). One week we will have assigned listening (35 questions) and a quiz (40 q's). Then the next week we will have a quiz, assigned listening, a test (70-80 q's), AND and a discussion post. Take an easier prof!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: If you do the chapter reading, the listening quizzes, and exams you will do just fine. There are a few discussion posts and concert reports. But, this is a very easy class if you just put in the time. She responds to emails and is helpful when you need it.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: professor justus is amazing! i only contacted her a few times throughout the semester but she is very caring and helpful! the majority of assignments are done through connect (no lockdown/webcam) and the quizzes and tests are super easy. the majority of test and quiz questions can be found on quizlet! i loved prof. justus!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Not flexible at all. Did not care about the problems I was having nor my attempts to try to talk to her about fixing it. Instead she let my grade suffer while I actually cared about it. Self-important and thinks the world revolves around her and her rules. It doesnt... Please dont take this womans class if you have other obligations in life.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Justus is such an understanding professor! Very lenient on due dates and everything you do will be on Connect: the textbook, quizzes, listening assignments, exams. Discussion posts will be on D2L, email her the concert reports, and final exam. Read the chapters and do the assignments, so simple. Always responded quickly to my e-mails.

Dr. Justus is VERY lenient with due dates. She is not a hard grader AT ALL, and she offers a TON of extra credit. She does NOT use webcam or lockdown browser either. I loved having her as an online professor. The only con is she takes a while to respond to emails.

I would definitely take her for online music. She is super sweet, and her class is not hard if you just do all the work. I don't mind online work, but it is a lot for some people, so only take her if you can do assignments that are due every week. She is so generous on extending dates and deadlines as well. I would 110% recommend her for online!!

Easiest online class ever. Homework was due every week, and all the answers are on Quizlet. Attend 3 concerts during the semester and write a short report on each one. All the final exam questions are on quizlet. I didn't make an A because I procrastinate too much. Take her online in you can! Only issue is she can take a while to respond to emails

Kayleen breathes music, you can tell she cares a lot about the subject. If you're into music history you'll probably like the lectures. I especially enjoyed the American music unit where we listened to/discussed genres like classic Rock n Roll. She also sometimes brought instruments for us to play. You must attend 3 concerts and write about them.

This class is very easy if you do the work. There are a lot of homework assignments but you have access to the online textbook and notes for each homework, quiz, test, and the final exam. Assignments are usually due on Sundays but you have a lot of time to do them. Every assignment is online and she does random in class participation assignments.
You'll pass the class if you do the homework and all of the readings. This is NOT an easy A, but Dr. Justus makes learning the material fun and enjoyable.
Dr. Justus, that's a no from me. Her class, while not difficult, is monotonous. She obviously cares about her niche, but it's a very tiny niche that she expects everyone else to be interested in.

Professor Justus is awesome as a teacher because she's very into what she's teaching, but the online work in the textbook for the class is tedious. She spaces it out well by week and is very understanding if something that's beyond your control happens but the course is easy as long as you stay on track and don't leave it all until the last second.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very passionate about her job. Really cares about class participation and student input. A lot of homework. Doesn't like taking attendance but will if a lot of people skip classes. Tries to make class fun but students really don't care.

This professor goes way overboard when taking her for Music 1107. She requires more work for this gen ed class than my upper level major classes. She expects you to do a chapter assignments, quizzes, tests and discussions every week using connect. The write ups for concert attendance are also way more in depth than any other professor. Do not take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are PRETTY boring and dull. She'll go on and on & would get upset when someone would ask a question. Textbook wasn't needed so don't bother getting it and make sure to attend the concerts prior to the due date!!!!!!

Nice helpful if you ask for it. Several extra credit opportunities available. take advantage of them! Lecture/PowerPoint heavy. Attendance to 3 live perf. events required and a report on only ONE of them due at end of semester. only tests and homework discussions. All tests online and not hard if you USE YOUR RESOURCES like groups for test "prep"
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Music of the Caribbean. This was the first time the class had been offered, so there were a few kinks to work out. Weekly reflections (500 words minimum) can be tedious because of all the info you're taking in. Research paper and album review also. She's very knowledgeable but sometimes I desired more structured class discussions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Her lectures are boring but do the work and you should be fine. The work is some discussions and the concerts. She asked a little too much for the one concert (an essay and a 10 minute presentation). There are four online tests and an online final. There's extra credit on her tests. She's nice and reasonable. Easy A.
She gives the longest and most boring lectures I have ever seen.  She can put you to sleep in seconds. She knows her material. Write the papers and you will pass.
Rude professor

I was hesitant to take her class because of her reviews, however, I made it out with an A. There is not much homework online, just a super easy test each week. Don't get the book, the entire test is from her notes she posts.

The lectures give a good understanding on to how Western Music came to be. By the time you complete the course, and providing you gave effort, you will leave with a decent foundation for analyzing music works. The professor is super nice and extremely reasonable. Would recommend.

She's really nice and she loves music but sitting through her class practically put me to sleep every day. Her lectures are very dry and there isn't much discussion. I just sit there and rot while she talks and talks and talks. She's just really boring as a teacher. She reads off her powerpoint verbatim. I probably would't take her again.
I took this class to fulfill the art class requirement. Basically what I did was go to class, copy and paste all the things on powerpoint. I did not even listen her speaking but I passed with an A.

go to class, take notes and you will pass all the tests. they are online. not a bad professor its just a relatively boring class. have to go to 3 outside events and write about 1. the 1 write up is a little ridiculous, way too much work for it. overall not  a bad class if you attend. will get an a and have no music experience at all!
Hated it, horrible teacher

If you have any music knowledge this class is super easy (don't buy book). If not, she tells you exactly what you need to know (buy book for assignments). There are listening analysis for every unit and there is always one option she went over in class. Test are online. Lectures are dry and reads powerpoints word for word. Super easy!
